official-title.#text:
To amend title 38, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to adopt and
			 implement a standard identification protocol for use in the tracking and
			 procurement of biological implants by the Department of Veterans Affairs,
			 and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: If the biological implant tracking system required by

header.#text: Procurement of biological implants used in Department of Veterans Affairs medical facilities

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the following new
			 section:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subchapter II of chapter 81 of such title

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may procure biological implants only from vendors that meet the following conditions:

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: under

and has safeguards to ensure that a
			 production identifier has been in place at each step of distribution of
			 each biological implant from its donor.

text.#text: The vendor uses the standard identification system adopted or implemented by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
under subpart B of part 1271 of
			 title 21, Code of Federal Regulations, or any successor regulation, and in
			 the case of a vendor that uses tissue distribution intermediaries, the
			 vendor uses only tissue distribution intermediaries that are appropriately
			 registered with the

text.#text: The vendor is registered with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may require accompany each biological implant at all times, regardless of
			 the country of origin of the donor of the biological material.

text.#text: The vendor ensures that donor eligibility determinations and such other records as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: regarding the accuracy of records and the handling of products.

text.#text: The vendor consents to periodic inspections and audits by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or by a
			 statutory order of the

text.#text:
The vendor agrees to cooperate with all biological implant recalls conducted on the vendor’s own
			 initiative, by the request of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
issued to the vendor by not later than 30
			 days after the vendor receives such report or warning letter.

text.#text: The vendor agrees to provide to the Secretary any adverse event report or warning letter of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for at least five years after the date of the procurement
			 of the biological implant.

text.#text:
The vendor agrees to retain all records associated with the procurement of a biological implant by
			 the

The vendor maintains active accreditation with the American Association of Tissue Banks or a
			 similar national accreditation specific to biological implants.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall procure biological implants under the Federal Supply Schedules of the

, unless such implants are not available under such
			 Schedules. For biological implants listed on the Federal Supply Schedules,
			 the

shall accommodate reasonable vendor requests to undertake
			 outreach efforts to educate medical professionals of the

about
			 the use and efficacy of such biological implants.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not apply to the procurement of biological implants.

shall procure such implants using competitive
			 procedures in accordance with applicable law and the Federal Acquisition
			 Regulation.

text.#text:
In the case of biological implants that are unavailable for procurement under the Federal Supply
			 Schedules, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
who is found responsible for a biological implant
			 procurement transaction with intent to avoid or with reckless disregard of
			 the requirements of this section shall be ineligible to hold a certificate
			 of appointment as a contracting officer or to serve as the representative
			 of an ordering officer, contracting officer, or purchase card holder.

text.#text:
In addition to any applicable penalty under any other provision of law, any procurement employee of
			 the
